TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract EmailOptions

Docs.summary: Contains global application-level attributes used by Microsoft Word when you create and edit e-mail messages and replies.

remarks.para: Use the property to return the EmailOptions object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyBorders { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyBorders : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if a series of three or more hyphens (-), equal signs (=), or underscore characters (_) are automatically replaced by a specific border line when the ENTER key is pressed.

remarks.para: This property returns True if a series of three or more hyphens (-), equal signs (=), or underscore characters (_) are automatically replaced by a specific border line when the ENTER key is pressed, and False if not.
Hyphens (-) are replaced by a 0.75-point line, equal signs (=) are replaced by a 0.75-point double line, and underscore characters (_) are replaced by a 1.5-point line.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyBulletedLists { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Determines if bullet characters (such as asterisks, hyphens, and greater-than signs) are replaced with bullets from the Bullets And Numbering dialog box (Format menu) as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if bullet characters (such as asterisks, hyphens, and greater-than signs) are replaced with bullets from the Bullets And Numbering dialog box (Format menu) as you type, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyClosings { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyClosings : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically applies the Closing style to letter closings as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically applies the Closing style to letter closings as you type, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyDates { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyDates : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically applies the Date style to dates as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word to automatically applies the Date style to dates as you type, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyFirstIndents { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyFirstIndents : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically replaces a space entered at the beginning of a paragraph with a first-line indent.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically replaces a space entered at the beginning of a paragraph with a first-line indent, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyHeadings { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyHeadings : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if styles are automatically applied to headings as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if styles are automatically applied to headings as you type, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyNumberedLists { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Determines if paragraphs are automatically formatted as numbered lists with a numbering scheme from the Bullets and Numbering dialog box (Format menu), according to what's typed.

remarks.para: This property returns True if paragraphs are automatically formatted, and False if not.

An example of this property's functionality is the following: if a paragraph starts with "1.1" and a tab character, Word automatically inserts "1.2" and a tab character after the ENTER key is pressed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyTables { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeApplyTables : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically creates a table when you type a plus sign, a series of hyphens, another plus sign, and so on, and then press ENTER.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically creates a table, and False if not.
The plus signs become the column borders, and the hyphens become the column widths.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeAutoLetterWizard { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeAutoLetterWizard : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically starts the Letter Wizard when the user enters a letter salutation or closing.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Microsoft Word automatically starts the Letter Wizard, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeDefineStyles { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeDefineStyles : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically creates new styles based on manual formatting.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically creates new styles based on manual formatting, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeDeleteAutoSpaces { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeDeleteAutoSpaces : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically deletes spaces inserted between Japanese and Latin text as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically deletes spaces, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeFormatListItemBeginning { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word repeats character formatting applied to the beginning of a list item to the next list item.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word repeats character formatting, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeInsertClosings { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeInsertClosings : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically inserts the corresponding memo closing when the user enters a memo heading.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically inserts the memo closing, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeInsertOvers { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeInsertOvers : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word to automatically inserts " " when the user enters "" or "".

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically inserts " ", and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeMatchParentheses { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeMatchParentheses : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically corrects improperly paired parentheses.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Microsoft Word automatically corrects improperly paired parentheses, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceFarEastDashes { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word automatically corrects long vowel sounds and dashes.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word automatically corrects long vowel sounds and dashes, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceFractions { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceFractions : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if typed fractions are replaced with fractions from the current character set as you type, as when "1/2" is replaced with "½."

remarks.para: This property returns True if typed fractions are replaced, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceHyperlinks { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceHyperlinks : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if e-mail addresses, server and share names (also known as UNC paths), and Internet addresses (also known as URLs) are automatically changed to hyperlinks as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if e-mail addresses, server and share names (also known as UNC paths), and Internet addresses (also known as URLs) are automatically changed to hyperlinks, and False if not.
Microsoft Word changes any text that looks like an e-mail address, UNC, or URL to a hyperlink. Word doesn't check the validity of the hyperlink.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceOrdinals { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceOrdinals : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if the ordinal number suffixes "st", "nd", "rd", and "th" are replaced with the same letters in superscript as you type, as when "1st" is replaced with "1" followed by "st" formatted as superscript.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the ordinal number suffixes "st", "nd", "rd", and "th" are replaced, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplacePlainTextEmphasis { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Determines if manual emphasis characters are automatically replaced with character formatting as you type, as when "*bold*" is changed to "bold" and "_underline_" is changed to "underline."

remarks.para: This property returns True if manual emphasis characters are automatically replaced, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceQuotes { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceQuotes : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if straight quotation marks are automatically changed to smart (curly) quotation marks as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if straight quotation marks are automatically changed to smart (curly) quotation marks as you type, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceSymbols { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoFormatAsYouTypeReplaceSymbols : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if two consecutive hyphens (--) are replaced with an en-dash (–) or an em-dash (—) as you type.

remarks.para: This property returns True if two consecutive hyphens (--) are replaced, and False if not.
If the hyphens are typed with leading and trailing spaces, Microsoft Word replaces the hyphens with an en dash; if there are no trailing spaces, the hyphens are replaced with an em-dash.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ComposeStyle As Style
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Style ^ ComposeStyle { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Style ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the style used to compose new e-mail messages.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Dummy1 As Boolean
public: property bool Dummy1 { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Dummy2 As Boolean
public: property bool Dummy2 { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dummy3() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EmailSignature As EmailSignature

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the signatures Microsoft Word appends to outgoing e-mail messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EmbedSmartTag { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.EmbedSmartTag : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word saves the smart tag information in HTML e-mail messages.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word saves the smart tag information in HTML e-mail messages, and False if not.

Use the EmbedSmartTag property when Word is specified as your e-mail editor and messages are sent using HTML. This allows recipients of the message to have access to the smart tag information without having the recognizer file registered on their computer. To make Word your default e-mail editor, change the necessary settings in Microsoft Outlook.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdEmailHTMLFidelity HTMLFidelity { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdEmailHTMLFidelity get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdEmailHTMLFidelity value); };

Docs.summary: Strips HTML tags that are used for opening HTML files in Microsoft Word but are not required for display.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MarkComments { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.MarkComments : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word marks the user's comments in e-mail messages.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word marks the user's comments in e-mail messages, and False if not.
This property marks comments with the value of the property. The default value of the MarkCommentsWith property is the value of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ MarkCommentsWith { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.MarkCommentsWith : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the string with which Microsoft Word marks comments in e-mail messages.

remarks.para: The default value is the value of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NewColorOnReply { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.NewColorOnReply : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether a user needs to choose a new color for reply text when replying to e-mail.

remarks.para: This property returns True to specify that a user needs to choose a new color, and False if not.
Use the NewColorOnReply property if you want the reply text of e-mail messages sent from Microsoft Word to be a different color than the original message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PlainTextStyle As Style
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Style ^ PlainTextStyle { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Style ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the object that represents the text attributes for e-mail messages that are sent or received using plain text.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RelyOnCSS { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RelyOnCSS : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if cascading style sheets (CSS) are used for font formatting when you view a saved document in a Web browser.

remarks.para: This property returns True if cascading style sheets are used, and False if HTML <FONT> tags and cascading style sheets are used. The default value is True.
Microsoft Word creates a cascading style sheet file and saves it either to the specified folder or to the same folder as your Web page, depending on the value of the property.

You should set this property to True if your Web browser supports cascading style sheets because this will give you more precise layout and formatting control on your Web page and make it look more like your document (as it appears in Microsoft Word).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ReplyStyle As Style
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Style ^ ReplyStyle { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Style ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the style used when replying to e-mail messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TabIndentKey { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.TabIndentKey : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if the TAB and BACKSPACE keys can be used to increase and decrease, respectively, the left indent of paragraphs and if the BACKSPACE key can be used to change right-aligned paragraphs to centered paragraphs and centered paragraphs to left-aligned paragraphs.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the TAB and BACKSPACE keys are used, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ThemeName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ThemeName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the theme plus any theme formatting options to use for new e-mail messages.

remarks.para: For an explanation of the value returned by this property, see the argument of the method. The value returned by this property may not correspond to the theme's display name as it appears in the Theme dialog box. To return a theme's display name, use the property.
You can also use the and methods to return and set the default theme for new e-mail messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseThemeStyle { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseThemeStyle : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if new e-mail messages use the character style defined by the default e-mail message theme.

remarks.para: This property returns True if new e-mail messages use the defined character style, and False if not.
If no default e-mail message theme has been specified, this property has no effect.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseThemeStyleOnReply { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseThemeStyleOnReply : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if Microsoft Word uses a theme when replying to e-mail.

remarks.para: This property returns True if Word uses a theme when replying to e-mail, and False if not.
